contentrichtext.text: {{Expand German|Ursula Stenzel|date=December 2009}} [[File:Ursula Stenzel.jpg|thumb|Ursula Stenzel]] '''Ursula Stenzel''' (born September 22, 1945, [[Leopoldstadt]], [[Vienna]]) is an [[Politics of Austria|Austrian politician]] and was a [[Member of the European Parliament]] until 2006. She is a member of the [[Austrian People's Party]], a member of the bureau of the [[European People's Party]], and sits on the [[European Parliament]]'s [[European Parliament Committee on Foreign Affairs|Committee on Foreign Affairs]]. She is also chair of the delegation for relations with the [[Korea|Korean Peninsula]], a member of the [[European Parliament Subcommittee on Security and Defence|Subcommittee on Security and Defence]], and a substitute for the [[European Parliament Committee on Budgetary Control|Committee on Budgetary Control]] and the [[European Parliament Committee on Employment and Social Affairs|Committee on Employment and Social Affairs]]. Stenzel has been ''Bezirksvorsteherin'' of [[Innere Stadt]] since 2005. == Family == Stenzel was born in a Catholic family of Jewish descent. Her father was engineer of the [[North railway (Austria)|North railway]]. Her mother was the daughter of a rabbi and chazzan in the [[Rotensterngasse]], Leopoldstadt. == Career == * Studied journalism, political science and modern history * Journalist and presenter at [[ORF (broadcaster)|ORF]] (1972–1999) * Member of the European Parliament * Delegation member, EU-Poland Joint Parliamentary Committee (1997–2002) * Delegation Chair, EU-Czech Republic Joint Parliamentary Committee (2002–2004) * [[Schuman Prize]] == Controversy == Stenzel has been criticised by local and national artists for her conservative positions and most notably for her outspoken support of a closing hour in Vienna's 1'st district ("Innere Stadt"). This culminated in a satirical video which covered the [[Duck Sauce]] [[hit]] [[Barbra Streisand (song)|"Barbra Streisand"]]. This video became known as Ursula Stressned (Ursula don't stress) and gained wide popularity within days and became a [[youtube]] [[fad]].<ref>[http://kurier.at/kult/2074032.php "Ursula Stressned" als YouTube-Protest. Mit einem viralen Musikvideo wehrt sich die Wiener Club-Szene gegen Sperrstunden] In: Kurier, am 16.02.2011, 20:49</ref><ref>[http://diepresse.com/home/panorama/wien/634700/Ursula-stress-ned_Protestsong-gegen-Sperrstunden „Ursula stress ned“: Protestsong gegen Sperrstunden] Die Presse, 16.02.2011</ref> == References == <references /> == External links == {{commons category}} * [http://www.europarl.europa.eu/members/archive/alphaOrder/view.do?id=2294&language=en European Parliament archive] * [http://wwwdb.europarl.eu.int/ep6-dif/2294_17-02-2005.PDF Declaration] of [[Declaration of financial interests|financial interests]] (in German; [[Portable Document Format|PDF]] file) {{See also|Stenzel}} {{Members of the European Parliament 1999–2004}} {{Members of the European Parliament 2004–2009}} {{Authority control|VIAF=38116806}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Stenzel, Ursula | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Austrian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = September 22, 1945 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stenzel, Ursula}} [[Category:1945 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:20th-century Austrian people]] [[Category:21st-century Austrian people]] [[Category:Austrian women in politics]] [[Category:Austrian People's Party MEPs]] [[Category:Female MEPs for Austria]] [[Category:MEPs for Austria 1996–1999]] [[Category:MEPs for Austria 1999–2004]] [[Category:MEPs for Austria 2004–2009]] [[Category:Austrian Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Converts to Roman Catholicism from Judaism]] [[Category:Austrian people of Jewish descent]] [[Category:People from Leopoldstadt]] {{MEP-stub}} {{Austria-politician-stub}}
